text: Hi, Can someone help me? How can you add custom css to HubSpot knowledge base?
Hey
I can help you

Hi all, does someone know if it’s possible to let the contact change their own emailaddress and company name. Yes I know they can change their subscription preferences but can’t find if they also can change their emailaddress.

Thnks in advance.
You could allow them to resubmit the form and as long as they’re cookied you should be fine
you can use FTP to edit the knowledge base CSS file

Today is a dark day for the internet, the EU just passed Article 11,12,13 and the rest of this crap :disappointed:  <https://www.wired.co.uk/article/what-is-article-13-article-11-european-directive-on-copyright-explained-meme-ban>
<https://www.eff.org/de/deeplinks/2018/06/eus-copyright-proposal-extremely-bad-news-everyone-even-especially-wikipedia>
<@UBT0AHWLD> thank you for sharing. definitely interesting, hopefully enough backlash comes about to make this more reasonable

since thousands of websites with millions of users ( i mean the small forums etc..) will be negatively effected, i am sure that there will be backlash...but i fear that this will help far right or other questionable parties
#niewiedercdu (in the EU it is the EVP).... is was trending a lot in Germany ( it means "cduneveragain" in English)

Has anyone else experienced issues today with the file manager? I had photos that were uploaded and working fine and now they show as broken on page, when i reupload them again they work temporarily and then break again
herm...

Has anyone (successfully) implemented Barba JS or some other PJAX library on HubSpot? I got to a point where it works fine even with CM specific dependencies but have an issue with HS CTAs as they trigger a redirect..

quick question.. with forms in custom modules, is there a way to have the option to send a follow up email? i know it is there when you use the regular form module, but its not when using the form option inside a custom module
<@U7BQUDTEJ> you have to add the fields yourself

I know this has been brought up before and the asnwer was something along the lines of "that functioanlity is actually a combination of multiple types of modules/features that are packaged under the form module" so it's not like it's actually something native to the form module itself. Though I feel like it was fixed at some point but I can't remember
that's how I do it ^
awesome thanks
best way is just find the default HubSpot form module and copy that
Yep, thats where I got that code from
do we know if HubSpot plans on making these default at somepoint, i know the webinar option is there by default
dont think so
if HubSpot does happen to make the change do you think it would cause modules already built like this to break

This is the way the default form module is built so it will have to be backwards compatible if they ever make changes. (I don’t know this for sure but am sure it would be too much trouble for HubSpot if it wasn’t)
How do you go about customizing a HubL search module to just search a particular blog? Any best practices here?
Hey all, is there an easy way of having a wrapping div element site-wide without changing every template?

Man i was trying this for a while but couldn't get the forms to load correctly since they are loaded after the dom - I assume the same with CTAs. I can live without CTAs but not forms. I was starting to read the forms js to see if I could trigger it manually from the barbajs callback but took the backburner and never went back to it
is said div in a module?

just got off the phone with HubSpot support is it really true that an import of URL redirects can take up to 24 hours to show up in the back end? trying to bulk upload about 150 URLs for a site launch
i dont remember that ever being the case

There is no div as of yet, but I'm looking for a way to add a div just after the opening body tag, and close the div right before the closing body tag. I don't think there's an easy way of achieving this within HubSpot that i know of
Javascript or use a coded template
normally it took 30mins from my experience
it’s been over an hour for us.. and there is no error or warning message if there was an issue with our file
we tried the first import around 5:30 EST
:disappointed:

seems like there are bugs with the new bulk import. we found some duplicate 301s in the import and it didn’t catch the error like the old importer. we have another site launch in the am so we are going to check if that was the problem
ah, I haven't used the new import yet
